INT eb_user ( INT  nfrag,
BOOL  mismatch,
EBUILDER_CHANNEL *  ebch,
EVENT_HEADER *  pheader,
void *  pevent,
INT *  dest_size 
)

Hook to the event builder task after the reception of all fragments of the same serial number. The destination event has already the final EVENT_HEADER setup with the data size set to 0. It is than possible to add private data at this point using the proper bank calls.

The ebch[] array structure points to nfragment channel structure with the following content: 

typedef struct {
    char  name[32];         // Fragment name (Buffer name).
    DWORD serial;           // Serial fragment number.
    char *pfragment;        // Pointer to fragment (EVENT_HEADER *)
    ...
} EBUILDER_CHANNEL;

The correct code for including your own MIDAS bank is shown below where TID_xxx is one of the valid Bank type starting with TID_ for midas format or xxx_BKTYPE for Ybos data format. bank_name is a 4 character descriptor. pdata has to be declared accordingly with the bank type. Refers to the ebuser.c source code for further description.

It is not possible to mix within the same destination event different event format! 

  // Event is empty, fill it with BANK_HEADER
  // If you need to add your own bank at this stage

  bk_init(pevent);
  bk_create(pevent, bank_name, TID_xxxx, &pdata);
  *pdata++ = ...;
  *dest_size = bk_close(pevent, pdata);
  pheader->data_size = *dest_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);

For YBOS format, use the following example.

  ybk_init(pevent);
  ybk_create(pevent, "EBBK", I4_BKTYPE, &pdata);
  *pdata++ = 0x12345678;
  *pdata++ = 0x87654321;
  *dest_size = ybk_close(pevent, pdata);
  *dest_size *= 4;
  pheader->data_size = *dest_size + sizeof(YBOS_BANK_HEADER);
Parameters:
nfrag Number of fragment.
mismatch Midas Serial number mismatch flag.
ebch Structure to all the fragments.
pheader Destination pointer to the header.
pevent Destination pointer to the bank header.
dest_size Destination event size in bytes.
Returns:
EB_SUCCESS

00522    char *psdata, *pddata;
00523    DWORD *pslrl, *pdlrl;

00525 
00526    /* Condition for new EVENT the data_size should be ZERO */
00527    *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00528 
00529    /* destination pointer skip the header as it has been already
00530       composed and the usere may have modified it on purpose (Midas Control) */

00532

00548

00550       memcpy(pddata, psdata, i1frgsize);
00551

00553       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += i1frgsize;
00554

00556       pdlrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest) + 1);
00557       *pdlrl += i4frgsize;
00558 
00559       /* Return event size in bytes */
00560       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size;
00561    } else {                     /* new destination event */
00562       /* The composed event has already the MIDAS header.
00563          which may have been modified by the user in ebuser.c
00564          Will be stripped by the logger (YBOS).
00565          Copy the first full event ( no EVID suppression )
00566          First event (without the event header) */
00567 
00568       /* source pointer */
00569       pslrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce) + 1);
00570 
00571       /* Swap event if necessary */
00572       status = ybos_event_swap(pslrl);
00573 
00574       /* size in byte from the source midas header */
00575       *size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) psrce)->data_size;
00576 
00577       /* copy first fragment */
00578       memcpy(pddata, (char *) pslrl, *size);
00579 
00580       /* update destination Midas header event size */
00581       ((EVENT_HEADER *) pdest)->data_size += *size;
00582

00584    return CM_SUCCESS;
00585 }

01082       debug = TRUE;
01083     else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'D')
01084       daemon = TRUE;
01085     else if (argv[i][0] == '-' && argv[i][1] == 'w')
01086       wheel = TRUE;
01087     else if (argv[i][0] == '-') {
01088       if (i + 1 >= argc || argv[i + 1][0] == '-')
01089         goto usage;
01090       if (strncmp(argv[i], "-e", 2) == 0)
01091         strcpy(expt_name, argv[++i]);
01092       else if (strncmp(argv[i], "-h", 2) == 0)
01093         strcpy(host_name, argv[++i]);
01094       else if (strncmp(argv[i], "-b", 2) == 0)
01095         strcpy(buffer_name, argv[++i]);
01096     } else {
01097 usage:
01098       printf("usage: mevb [-h <Hostname>] [-e <Experiment>] -b <buffername> [-d debug]\n");
01099       printf("             -w show wheel -D to start as a daemon\n\n");
01100       return 0;
01101     }
01102   }
01103 
01104   printf("Program mevb version 5 started\n\n");
01105   if (daemon) {
01106     printf("Becoming a daemon...\n");
01107     ss_daemon_init(FALSE);
01108   }
01109 
01110   /* Check buffer arg */
01111   if (buffer_name[0] == 0) {
01112     printf("Buffer name must be specified with -b argument\n");
01113     goto exit;
01114   }
01115 
01116   /* Compose frontend name */
01117    strcpy(full_frontend_name, frontend_name);
01118 
01119   /* Connect to experiment */
01120   status = cm_connect_experiment(host_name, expt_name, full_frontend_name, NULL);
01121   if (status != CM_SUCCESS) {
01122     ss_sleep(5000);
01123     goto exit;
01124   }
01125 
01126   if (debug)
01127     cm_set_watchdog_params(TRUE, 0);
01128 
01129   /* Connect to ODB */
01130   status = cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, &hKey);
01131   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01132     ss_sleep(5000);
01133     goto exit;
01134   }
01135   
01136   /* check if Ebuilder is already running */
01137   status = cm_exist(full_frontend_name, TRUE);
01138   if (status == CM_SUCCESS) {
01139     cm_msg(MERROR, "Ebuilder", "%s running already!.", full_frontend_name);
01140     cm_disconnect_experiment();
01141     goto exit;
01142   }
01143 
01144   if (ebuilder_init() != SUCCESS) {
01145     cm_disconnect_experiment();
01146     /* let user read message before window might close */
01147     ss_sleep(5000);
01148     goto exit;
01149   }
01150 
01151   /* Register single equipment */
01152   status = register_equipment();
01153   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01154     ss_sleep(5000);
01155     goto exit;
01156   }
01157 
01158   /* Load Fragment info */
01159   status = load_fragment();
01160   if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01161     ss_sleep(5000);
01162     goto exit;
01163   }
01164 
01165   /* Register transition for reset counters */
01166   if (cm_register_transition(TR_START, tr_start, 300) != CM_SUCCESS)
01167     return status;
01168   if (cm_register_transition(TR_STOP, tr_stop, 700) != CM_SUCCESS)
01169     goto exit;
01170 
01171   /* Scan fragments... will stay in */
01172   status = scan_fragment();
01173   printf("%s-Out of scan_fragment\n", full_frontend_name);
01174 
01175   /* Detach all source from midas */
01176   printf("%s-Unbooking\n", full_frontend_name);
01177   source_unbooking();
01178   
01179   ebuilder_exit();
01180 
01181 exit:
01182   /* Free local memory */
01183   free_event_buffer(ebset.nfragment);
01184 
01185   /* Clean disconnect from midas */
01186   cm_disconnect_experiment();
01187   return 0;
01188 }

00377           printf("...%c Snoring\r", bars[i_bar++ % 4]);
00378           fflush(stdout);
00379         }
00380         break;
00381       case STATE_RUNNING:

00390                     break;

00394                       printf("...%c Timoing on %1.0lf\r", bars[i_bar++ % 4],

00396                       fflush(stdout);
00397                       status = cm_yield(50);
00398                     }
00399                   }
00400                 }

00402               } // for loop over all fragments
00403               break;
00404             case EB_ERROR:
00405             case EB_USER_ERROR:
00406               abort_requested = TRUE;
00407               if (status == EB_USER_ERROR)

00412                 cm_msg(MERROR, "EBuilder", "%s: Stop Transition request failed", full_frontend_name);
00413                 return status;
00414               }
00415               if (debug) printf("Stop requested on Error %d\n", status);
00416               status = close_buffers();
00417               return status;
00418               break;
00419             case EB_SUCCESS:
00420             case EB_SKIP:
00421               //   Normal path if event has been assembled
00422               //   No yield in this case.
00423               break;
00424             default:
00425               cm_msg(MERROR, "Source_scan", "unexpected return %d", status);
00426               status = SS_ABORT;

00428         break;
00429     }

00431     /* Check if it's time to do statistics job */
00432     if ((actual_millitime = ss_millitime()) - last_time > 1000) {
00433       /* Force event to appear at the destination if Ebuilder is remote */
00434       rpc_flush_event();
00435       /* Force event ot appear at the destination if Ebuilder is local */
00436       bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, ASYNC);
00437

00439 
00440       eq = &equipment[0];
00441       eq->stats.events_sent += eq->events_sent;
00442       eq->stats.events_per_sec =
00443         eq->events_sent / ((actual_millitime - last_time) / 1000.0);
00444       eq->stats.kbytes_per_sec =
00445         eq->bytes_sent / 1024.0 / ((actual_millitime - last_time) /
00446         1000.0);
00447       eq->bytes_sent = 0;
00448       eq->events_sent = 0;
00449       /* update destination statistics */
00450       db_send_changed_records();
00451       /* Keep track of last ODB update */
00452       last_time = ss_millitime();
00453     }
00454   } while (status != RPC_SHUTDOWN && status != SS_ABORT);
00455 
00456   return status;

INT source_scan ( INT  fmt,
EQUIPMENT_INFO *  eq_info 
)

Scan all the fragment source once per call.

  1. This will retrieve the full midas event not swapped (except the MIDAS_HEADER) for each fragment if possible. The fragment will be stored in the channel event pointer.
  2. if after a full nfrag path some frag are still not cellected, it returns with the frag# missing for timeout check.
  3. If ALL fragments are present it will check the midas serial# for a full match across all the fragments.
  4. If the serial check fails it returns with "event mismatch" and will abort the event builder but not stop the run for now.
  5. If the serial check is passed, it will call the user_build function where the destination event is going to be composed.
Parameters:
fmt Fragment format type
eq_info Equipement pointer
dest_hBuf Destination buffer handle
Returns:
EB_NO_MORE_EVENT, EB_COMPOSE_TIMEOUT if different then SUCCESS (bm_compose, rpc_sent error)

Definition at line 905 of file new_mevb.cpp.

References ASYNC, bars, bk_swap(), BM_ASYNC_RETURN, bm_compose_event(), bm_receive_event(), BM_SUCCESS, eqpmnt::bytes_sent, cm_msg, debug, debug1, dest_event, EB_ERROR, EB_SKIP, EB_SUCCESS, eb_user(), EQUIPMENT_INFO::event_id, event_mismatch, eqpmnt::events_sent, FALSE, FORMAT_MIDAS, FORMAT_YBOS, found, full_frontend_name, hBuf, i, i_bar, j, max_event_size, meb_fragment_add, MERROR, nfragment, EBUILDER_CHANNEL::pfragment, EBUILDER_SETTINGS::preqfrag, psbh, EBUILDER_SETTINGS::received, rpc_send_event(), EBUILDER_CHANNEL::serial, serial, size, status, SUCCESS, SYNC, EBUILDER_CHANNEL::timeout, EQUIPMENT_INFO::trigger_mask, TRUE, EBUILDER_SETTINGS::user_build, and ybos_event_swap().

00906 {
00907    static char bars[] = "|/-\\";
00908    static int i_bar;
00909    static DWORD serial;
00910    DWORD *plrl;
00911    BOOL   complete;
00912    INT i, j, status, size;
00913    INT act_size;
00914    BOOL found, event_mismatch;
00915    BANK_HEADER *psbh;
00916 
00917    status = SUCCESS;
00918 
00919    /* Scan all channels at least once */
00920    for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00921       /* Check if current channel needs to be received */
00922      if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && !ebset.received[i]) {
00923          /* Get fragment and store it in ebch[i].pfragment */
00924          size = max_event_size;
00925          status = bm_receive_event(ebch[i].hBuf, ebch[i].pfragment, &size, ASYNC);
00926          switch (status) {
00927          case BM_SUCCESS:      /* event received */
00928             /* Mask event */
00929             ebset.received[i] = TRUE;
00930             /* Keep local serial */
00931             ebch[i].serial = ((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment)->serial_number;
00932 
00933             /* Swap event depending on data format */
00934             switch (fmt) {
00935             case FORMAT_YBOS:
00936                plrl = (DWORD *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment) + 1);
00937                ybos_event_swap(plrl);
00938                break;
00939             case FORMAT_MIDAS:
00940                psbh = (BANK_HEADER *) (((EVENT_HEADER *) ebch[i].pfragment) + 1);
00941                bk_swap(psbh, FALSE);
00942                break;
00943             }
00944 
00945             if (debug1) {
00946               printf("SUCC: ch:%d ser:%d rec:%d sz:%d\n", i,
00947                       ebch[i].serial, ebset.received[i], size);
00948             }
00949             break;
00950          case BM_ASYNC_RETURN: /* timeout */
00951             ebch[i].timeout++;
00952             if (debug1) {
00953               printf("ASYNC: ch:%d ser:%d rec:%d sz:%d\n", i,
00954                       ebch[i].serial, ebset.received[i], size);
00955             }
00956             break;
00957          default:              /* Error */
00958             cm_msg(MERROR, "event_scan", "bm_receive_event error %d", status);
00959             return status;
00960             break;
00961          }
00962       }    /* next channel */
00963    }
00964 
00965    /* Check if all fragments have been received */
00966    complete = FALSE;
00967    for (i = 0; i < nfragment;i++) {
00968      if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && !ebset.received[i])
00969        break;
00970    }
00971    if (i == nfragment) {
00972      complete = TRUE;
00973      /* Check if serial matches */
00974      found = event_mismatch = FALSE;
00975      /* Check Serial, mark first serial */
00976      for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
00977          if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && ebset.received[i] && !found) {
00978             serial = ebch[i].serial;
00979             found = TRUE;
00980          } else {
00981             if (ebset.preqfrag[i] && ebset.received[i] && (serial != ebch[i].serial)) {
00982                /* Event mismatch */
00983                event_mismatch = TRUE;
00984             }
00985          }
00986       }
00987 
00988     /* internal action in case of event mismatch */
00989      if (event_mismatch && debug) {
00990        char str[256];
00991        char strsub[128];
00992        strcpy(str, "event mismatch: ");
00993        for (j = 0; j < nfragment; j++) {
00994          sprintf(strsub, "Ser[%d]:%d ", j, ebch[j].serial);
00995          strcat(str, strsub);
00996        }
00997        printf("event serial mismatch %s\n", str);
00998      }
00999 
01000      /* In any case reset destination buffer */
01001      memset(dest_event, 0, sizeof(EVENT_HEADER));
01002      act_size = 0;
01003 
01004      /* Fill reserved header space of destination event with
01005      final header information */
01006      bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event, eq_info->event_id, eq_info->trigger_mask,
01007        act_size, ebch[0].serial);
01008 
01009      /* Pass fragments to user with mismatch flag, for final check before assembly */
01010      status = eb_user(nfragment, event_mismatch, ebch
01011        , (EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event,(void *) ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event + 1), &act_size);
01012      if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01013        if (status == EB_SKIP) {
01014          /* Reset mask and timeouts as even thave been succesfully send */
01015          for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01016            ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01017            ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
01018          }
01019        }
01020        return status;        // Event mark as EB_SKIP or EB_ABORT by user
01021      }
01022 
01023      /* Allow bypass of fragment assembly if user did it on its own */
01024      if (!ebset.user_build) {
01025        for (j = 0; j < nfragment; j++) {
01026          if (ebch[j].set.emask) {
01027            status = meb_fragment_add(dest_event, ebch[j].pfragment, &act_size);
01028            if (status != EB_SUCCESS) {
01029              cm_msg(MERROR, "source_scan",
01030                "compose fragment:%d current size:%d (%d)", j, act_size, status);
01031              return EB_ERROR;
01032            }
01033          }
01034        }
01035      }
01036 
01037      /* Overall event to be sent */
01038      act_size = ((EVENT_HEADER *) dest_event)->data_size + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
01039 
01040      /* Send event and wait for completion */
01041      status = rpc_send_event(equipment[0].buffer_handle, dest_event, act_size, SYNC);
01042      if (status != BM_SUCCESS) {
01043        if (debug)
01044          printf("rpc_send_event returned error %d, event_size %d\n",
01045          status, act_size);
01046        cm_msg(MERROR, "EBuilder", "%s: rpc_send_event returned error %d", full_frontend_name, status);
01047        return EB_ERROR;
01048      }
01049 
01050      /* Keep track of the total byte count */
01051      equipment[0].bytes_sent += act_size;
01052 
01053      /* update destination event count */
01054      equipment[0].events_sent++;
01055 
01056      /* Reset mask and timeouts as even thave been succesfully send */
01057      for (i = 0; i < nfragment; i++) {
01058        ebch[i].timeout = 0;
01059        ebset.received[i] = FALSE;
01060      }
01061    } // all fragment recieved for this event
01062 
01063    return status;
01064 }
